Class ensemble.hot.Hot_ObjectMessage 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ensemble.hot.Hot_Buffer
           |
           +----ensemble.hot.Hot_Message
                   |
                   +----ensemble.hot.Hot_ObjectMessage
public class Hot_ObjectMessage
extends Hot_Message
This HOT Message class is a mechanism to transmit Java objects over ensemble. It makes use of the Java serialization mechanism. That being said, the usual rules about an Object being serializable apply (see the Java docs for more information here). To send an Object over ensemble, just create a Hot_ObjectMessage with the Serializable object, and call the usual Send or Cast. When your ReceiveCast/Send upcall hands you a Hot_Message reference, you create a new Hot_ObjectMessage from that reference, and then do a getObject() on the new Hot_ObjectMessage.

Hot_ObjectMessage()
Hot_ObjectMessage(byte[])
Interprets the bytes as a serialized object and constructs a new Hot_ObjectMessage based upon this Object.
Hot_ObjectMessage(Hot_Message)
Takes the bytes contained within a Hot_Message object (usually gotten from a standard ReceiveCast/Send upcall) and interprets them as a serialized object.
Hot_ObjectMessage(Object)
Creates a new Hot_ObjectMessage based upon this Object.

getBytes()
Serializes the contained object into a byte array
getObject()
Get the contained Object
setBytes(byte[])
Interprets the bytes as a serialized object and sets the contained reference to the unserialized version of the serialized object
setObject(Object)
Set the contained Object
